node.title: Woman stabbed to death in Chinatown apartment
node.description: Christina Yuna Lee was allegedly followed up six flights of stairs by 25-year-old suspect Assamad Nash.

node.title: Rare baby ghost shark found in ocean off the South Island
node.description: Even scientists who study the deep-water sharks have seen precious few of them, and newly hatched ghost shark finds are rarer still. Audio

node.title: $3m bill to clean dioxin out of New Plymouth wastewater treatment plant
node.description: A $3 million clean-up operation to remove highly toxic dioxin from the New Plymouth wastewater treatment plant has sparked calls for an investigation into where else the compound may be lurking.

node.title: Omicron outbreak: Isolation changes, return-to-work testing as NZ heads to 'phase two'
node.description: Fewer people will be considered Covid-19 contacts and isolation requirements will be relaxed as the country enters phase two of the strategy for Omicron tomorrow.

node.title: Businesses near Parliament struggling with protest on doorstep
node.description: Businesses near Parliament say they are only just holding on, with customers scared off by the massive group of protesters occupying the grounds.

node.title: Americans win Olympic gold and silver in women's monobob
node.description: Kaillie Humphries brings home gold weeks after becoming a U.S. citizen. The silver is the 4th Olympic medal for Elana Meyers Taylor.

node.title: Trades sector sees wage growth across the board
node.description: The country's industrial and trades sector has seen near universal wage growth, with employers feeling the effects of a tight labour market.

node.title: Police road safety operation misses the target
node.description: A nationwide police operation to cut down on high-risk driving and road deaths has gone badly, an OIA reveals.

node.title: Ransomware gang claims it hacked San Francisco 49ers
node.description: The NFL team said In a statement that it recently became aware of a "network security incident."

node.title: Rogue ram meets unfortunate end after bruising encounters on cycle trail
node.description: An aggressive ram in Central Otago has been butting heads with cyclists on the popular Lake Dunstan Trail.

node.title: Covid-19: 164 schools and early childhood centres have cases
node.description: More than 160 schools, kura, and early childhood centres are managing identified Covid-19 cases in students or staff.

node.title: Navy engineer Jonathan Toebbe pleads guilty in spy case
node.description: The engineer was accused of hiding memory cards in a peanut butter sandwich, a Band-Aid wrapper and a chewing gum package that were left at dead drops.

node.title: Man who maintains innocence gets day in court 44 years after conviction
node.description: Vincent Simmonsâ€‹'s court hearing Monday afternoon comes after CBS News uncovered new evidence that could play a role in the case.

node.title: Abuse survivors fear Catholic Church's power - advocate
node.description: The Abuse in Care inquiry has been told survivors of historical abuse live in fear of the power of the Catholic Church.

node.title: Rams roar home to win Super Bowl
node.description: The LA Rams have topped the Bengals 23-20 to win Super Bowl LVI.

node.title: Coast Guard searches for downed plane with 8 aboard off North Carolina
node.description: An air traffic controller reported the plane was "behaving erratically on radar and then disappeared from the radar screen," the Coast Guard said.

node.title: Amazon and Walmart lift mask rules for vaccinated workers
node.description: Retailing giants tell employees they can ditch facial coverings if fully inoculated against COVID-19.

node.title: Russian units near Ukraine moved into "attack positions," official says
node.description: Russia has moved some long-range artillery and rocket launchers into firing position, according to a U.S. official.

node.title: Skier dies in fall in Grand Teton National Park's Death Canyon
node.description: Radcliff Spencer's remains were taken to the coroner, and the other four people who were with the skier were taken out of the canyon by helicopter.

node.title: Merger and acquisition activity set to increase
node.description: The number of mergers and acquisitions (M&A) nearly doubled last year, with the trend set to continue into this year.

node.title: Parliament protest: Negotiation expert pushes for mediation
node.description: The government must meet the protesters and listen to their concerns in order for the occupation of Parliament's grounds to be resolved, the former lead crisis negotiator for police says. Audio

node.title: Russian figure skater can compete at Beijing Olympics
node.description: Russian figure skater Kamila Valieva will be allowed to compete in the women's single in figure skating at the Beijing Olympics after a decision by sport's top court CAS on Monday.

node.title: Cyclone Dovi: Cleanup continues after winds down trees, cause power cuts
node.description: Damage from ex-tropical Cyclone Dovi has left people stranded in their homes, while power outages are affecting farms and schools.

node.title: Barry Manilow music blasted to disperse vaccine protesters
node.description: The tactic has not worked, as protesters continue to converge on the nation's capital.

node.title: What's behind Blinken's whistle-stop tour of the region
node.description: Analysis - International analyst Geoffrey Miller explains the significance of Antony Blinken's whistle-stop tour of the region.

node.title: Arrivals from Tonga will soon have to self-isolate due to rising Covid-19 cases
node.description: Tonga no longer meets the criteria for quarantine-free travel due to increasing Covid-19 cases, Director-General of Health Dr Ashley Bloomfield announced this evening.

node.title: Louisville mayoral candidate targeted in shooting, police say
node.description: It appeared the candidate, Craig Greenberg, was targeted, Louisville Metro police chief Erika Shields said.

node.title: NZX 50 index closes down 1.8 percent
node.description: The local sharemarket's slide continues with investors fretting about rising interest rates.

node.title: First-home buyers 'hampered by tighter credit policies' - CoreLogic
node.description: Controversial credit protection legislation is having an adverse effect on first-home buyers, but cash buyers could play a more prominent role this year.

node.title: Jacinda Ardern to protesters: 'Go home and take your children'
node.description: The prime minister says the behaviour of protesters at Parliament doesn't suggest to her that the group are interested in engaging when it comes to finding a solution. Audio
